Hi!

I'm Jason Banks and I'm a full-stack web developer; previously, I practiced corporate law.

I want to solve problems.

Stack

Ruby, JavaScript, jQuery, Rails, Sinatra, HTML, CSS, SCSS, Backbone, SQL, JSON, Bootstrap, Foundation, Bourbon &c., Git, Heroku, FFMPEG, RSpec, AWS, APIs

Hearts

Cycling, novelty, color(s), Monocle, teamwork, slightly sweet Manhattans, travel, making ice cream, Dr Who, surfwear brands' streetwear, and (riparian) breakfasts.

trellisd

What would be the lovechild of Facebook and Craigslist, trellisd matches posts from users with complementary posts from other, connected users. In other words, trellisd aims to remove all of the, "Does anyone know anyone who...?" posts in your newsfeed.

trellisd is a complete, responsive platform: user accounts and sign-in, profiles, messaging, and Facebook integration.

Dev Jobs(?) Tweets

Realizing that a number of developer jobs are advertised on Twitter, I built this app as an efficient way to search Twitter for them.

Using Twitter's API, Dev Jobs Tweets finds and filters tweets that may be related to dev job openings. Styled to respond to desktop, tablets, and mobiles.

Daft Lighting

Inspired by iDaft, Daft Lightning was an exercise to help me better understand Javascript, jQuery and CSS animations. While the apps above are built on Rails, Daft Lighting runs on Sinatra.
